metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15690 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
heap buffer overflow in libvncclient/cursor.c related to large cursor sizes when connected to a malicious server

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15690` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.4
libvncserver-config - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.4
libvncserver1 - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.4').
x11vnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
